definitions.definition: To give off light from heat or to emit light as if heated.
definitions.example: The fire was still glowing after ten hours.

definitions.definition: To radiate some emotional quality like light.
definitions.example: The zealots glowed with religious fervor.

definitions.definition: To gaze especially passionately at something.

definitions.example: After their workout, the gymnasts' faces were glowing red.
The new baby's room glows with bright, loving colors.

definitions.definition: To feel hot; to have a burning sensation, as of the skin, from friction, exercise, etc.; to burn.
The action of the verb glow.

definitions.example: He received glowing references from his previous employers.
